definition: handed down in a family/family traditions

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: I heritate the royal blood family.
sentences.chinese: 精忠的赤血点染了我的家传。

sentences.english: Still bore ( the family) arms, and had for his crest a cock argent.
sentences.chinese: 他仍然带着家传的武器，头盔上饰有一只银鸡。

sentences.english: Since 1973, their family a traditional flavored Laksa.
sentences.chinese: 家传着1973年至今的古早味辣沙。

sentences.english: Now it looks as if it might be part of the original family recipe.
sentences.chinese: 目前看来，它可能早已是人们家传食物秘方的一部分。

definition: passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
to hand down secret knowledge from generation to generation within a school or family etc
handed down in a direct line from the founder
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to pass on through the generations
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
